basics.name: Eric
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Biochemistry at the University of Hawaii with a minor in Computer Science. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2021.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.company: Allsop Lab, Institute of Biogenesis Research at John A. Burns School of Medicine
work.summary: The Allsopp lab does research into healthy aging, centered around an enzyme that extends the telomeres of oneâ€™s DNA which prevents detrimental DNA damage.
highlights: Conducting primary data analysis of genotype, cytokine levels, gene expression, and protein activity of Okinawan blood samples.
Implementing a machine learning algorithm in Python to relate biological inflammatory markers with aging.
Developed skills in critical thinking, customer service, and multitasking.

volunteer.position: Volunteer for Magic Island Relay for Life Committee
volunteer.summary: The Magic Island Relay for Life is a fundraising event held by the American Cancer Society to fund cancer research and public policy.
highlights: Worked with a team to organize the silent auction, which raised over $10,000 dollars in funding.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
